headline: Oracle in Talks With Meta for Cloud Computing Deal
summary: Oracle is in discussions with Meta Platforms for a cloud computing deal worth about $20 billion. Under the multiyear deal, Oracle would provide the social media giant with computing power for training and deploying artificial intelligence models, according to people familiar with the talks. Brody Ford has more on "Bloomberg The Close."

Brody Ford has more on "Bloomberg The Close."

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: TikTok Is Saved Again
summary: TikTok deal here--but details are scant.  President Trump said he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping reached an agreement for a group of investors to take control of TikTok’s U.S. operations.  A TikTok deal was widely expected, but still sparked some weakness for U.S.-based rivals.

headline: Oracle stock surges on potential $20B Meta AI cloud deal
summary: Investing.com -- Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) stock surged 4.4% to a session high heading into the close on Friday after Bloomberg reported the company is in talks with Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) for a cloud computing deal worth approximately $20 billion.

raw.headline: Oracle stock surges on potential $20B Meta AI cloud deal

headline: Oracle in Talks With Meta on $20 Billion AI Cloud Deal
summary: Under the multiyear deal, Oracle would provide the social media giant with computing power for training and deploying artificial intelligence models, according to people familiar with the talks.  The contract would add to a series of wins for Oracle’s cloud infrastructure business.  Oracle has previously disclosed cloud business with Meta and other companies that train AI models, including Elon Musk’s xAI.

raw.headline: Oracle in Talks With Meta on $20 Billion AI Cloud Deal
raw.summary: Under the multiyear deal, Oracle would provide the social media giant with computing power for training and deploying artificial intelligence models, according to people familiar with the talks.  The contract would add to a series of wins for Oracle’s cloud infrastructure business.  Oracle has previously disclosed cloud business with Meta and other companies that train AI models, including Elon Musk’s xAI.

headline: Oracle eyes $20 billion AI cloud computing deal with Meta, source says
summary: (Reuters) -Oracle is in talks with Meta for a multi-year cloud computing deal worth about $20 billion, underscoring the social media giant's drive to secure faster access to computing power, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.  Oracle would provide Meta with computing capacity for training and deploying AI models, in addition to Meta's existing cloud computing providers, the person said.  Both Meta and Oracle did not immediately respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

raw.headline: Oracle eyes $20 billion AI cloud computing deal with Meta, source says
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Oracle is in talks with Meta for a multi-year cloud computing deal worth about $20 billion, underscoring the social media giant's drive to secure faster access to computing power, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.  Oracle would provide Meta with computing capacity for training and deploying AI models, in addition to Meta's existing cloud computing providers, the person said.  Both Meta and Oracle did not immediately respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

summary: “Based on past infrastructure build-outs and how they led to bubbles,” the Meta CEO said on the Access podcast, it’s quite possible “that something like that would happen here.”

headline: Meta pushes into power trading as AI boom sends demand soaring
summary: The company, which owns Facebook, submitted the filing Tuesday to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission asking for authorization “to sell energy, capacity, and certain ancillary services.”  Buying more electricity has become an increasingly urgent challenge for big technology companies such as Meta, Microsoft Corp. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google.  Power demand from the data centers used to build and run AI models is set to quadruple in 10 years, based on projections from BloombergNEF.

Power demand from the data centers used to build and run AI models is set to quadruple in 10 years, based on projections from BloombergNEF.

headline: US chip independence is a 'vital necessity': Gary Cohn on AI
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) announced a $5 billion stake in Intel (INTC) alongside a joint partnership in developing artificial intelligence (AI) chips. This happened while the US and the UK agreed to a $42 billion tech agreement — the Tech Prosperity Deal — during President Trump's visit to the UK, accompanied by Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang. International Business Machines (IBM) Vice Chair Gary Cohn sits down with Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to weigh in on Big Tech's heavy investments and CapEx spending into AI and data center infrastructure. Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Gary Cohn by clicking here. Cohn also served as the director of the National Economic Council (NEC) under the first Trump administration, from 2017 to 2018. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
